hints.content:
First, let's find the area and perimeter of the striped rectangle.  


[[☃ image 1]]

We can find area of a rectangle by multiplying its length by its width.  
Area $= \greenD8 \times \greenD5 = \greenD{40} \text{ sq cm}$ 

We find perimeter by adding the lengths of the sides.  
Perimeter $= \greenD8 + \greenD8 + \greenD5 + \greenD5 = \greenD{26} \text{ cm}$

options.alt: A wide rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 5 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 8 centimeters. !

hints.content:
Next, we find the area and perimeter of the other rectangle. 

$$ | Area | Perimeter
:- | :- | :-
![A wide rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 5 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 8 centimeters.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/bd19da107301399d2d2407015d1c49c75d6b8282) | $\greenD8 \!\times\!\! \greenD5 \!=\!\! \greenD{40} \text{ sq cm}$  | $\greenD8 \!+\!\! \greenD8 \!+\!\! \greenD5 \!+\!\! \greenD5 \!=\!\! \greenD{26} \text{ cm}$
![A tall rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 10 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 3 centimeters.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2362d1c42eb35a10bdeaf67dabe2abeba374682f) | $\blueD3 \!\times\!\!\! \blueD{10} \!=\!\! \blueD{30} \text{ sq cm}$   | $\blueD3 \!+\!\! \blueD3\!+\!\!\! \blueD{10} \!+\!\!\! \blueD{10} \!=\! \!\blueD{26} \text{ cm}$

Now, lets compare the area and perimeters of the rectangles.

Area:  
$\greenD{40}\text { sq cm}\neq\blueD{30}\text{ sq cm}$

Perimeter:  
$\greenD{26}\text { cm}=\blueD{26}\text{ cm}$
The rectangles have the same perimeter only.

options.alt: A wide rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 5 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 8 centimeters. !
